Posts.Content: djsbaby wrote: Had to go to the hospital on Tuesday.  I have had the redness for almost 4 months and have spent the last almost 6 months trying to figure out what is going on.  Well on Monday I noticed a sore on the right breast, didn't think much of it.  I have kids and a dog whom I play with, figured I got scratched.  Well Tuesday night I call my husband into the bathroom in a panic, from the sore to my armpit was a deep red, hot line.  I was debating calling the doc on Wednesday morning.  Dh and I talked about it and agreed I should go in now rather than later.  By the time I got there my bp and heartrate was sky high.  I started throwing up and the pain was excruciating.  Admitted for iv antibiotics, pain meds and nausea meds.  They did an ultrasound and nothing!  No sign of what was going on, obvious from the outside but nothing showing on the inside.  Got out Thursday with the most powerful antibiotic that can be taken orally.  I was hoping this would help with the redness, no such luck.  I have a feeling that I will be going in for another biopsy soon. Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2011 04:14PM djsbaby wrote: Well met with the bs yesterday after they made sure to squeeze me in for an appointment (when I called last Friday,  she was booked solid all week).  After talking about recent events she decided to do an FNA biopsy.  She said she should have the results Monday at the latest and will give me a call. Antibiotics took care of the redness from the infection but not the redness that has been present since Jan.  At this point I don't care if it's cancer, I just want an answer.

Posts.Title: Nervous about appt. djsbaby djsbaby

Posts.Content: djsbaby wrote: I will start out with an introduction because I rudely forgot to do that.  I am 32 years old with 3 little ones.  In October I had some severe pain in right breast, pus followed by bloody nipple discharge.  Went to ob/gyn who ordered a mammogram and gave me a referral to breast specialist (surgeon).  Had first appt with surgeon and he sent me for a ductogram.  They did a bilateral and the left was fine, the right hurt so bad I was crying while they were doing it.  The doctor was going to sedate me but I had nobody else there with me.  Mammogram came back negative and ductogram came back good on left and unsuccessful on the right.  The surgon said this was good and to keep an eye on it for any changes, increase in drainage or pain getting worse to come see him again.  Three weeks later I was still in pain and noticed swelling and a redness near the nipple.  I thought maybe dry skin so I just shrugged it off.  The redness then spread to at least 1/3 of my breast and the swelling was so bad.  I called to the doctor who sent me to the er.  Er did bloodwork looking for infection and found none.  Still put me on antibiotics just in case.  This was last Wed.  No change by Monday I put a call back into the doc and he saw me this morning.  He asked if I had and u/s done and I said no.  All of a sudden I am on my way to the hospital for an u/s with possible drainage (with three kids in tow.).  Tech preformed u/s and the radiologist came in and did it again.  Nothing.  The look on their faces was grim.  Well I have a new antibiotic for a week and if no change he is doing a biopsy. All I keep thinking about is the look on their faces.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Doctor appt-down in the dumps djsbaby djsbaby

Posts.Content: Feb 1, 2011 05:37PM djsbaby wrote: DocBabs, Actually for me to have any procedures done, in this case the biopsy, it has to be done in an operating room.  I have severe, life threatening allergies to anesthetics.  I have to have a new or,  meaning the first of the day.  There has to be special equipment in the or for me should I have a reaction.  Even for me to have emergency surgery to have my appendix out took two hours of wait time for the room to be ready.  I am glad we are trying a new antibiotic because I am not really looking forward to having the biopsy unless I absolutely need it.
Posts.Title: Doctor appt-down in the dumps djsbaby djsbaby

Posts.Content: djsbaby wrote: I was wondering if this sounded like Inflammatory Breast Cancer.   It started in October 2010 with severe pain in right breast.  I took a shower and a large amount of pus started coming out of nipple, followed by blood.  Went to ob/gyn who ordered a mammogram and referred me to a breast surgeon.  He sent me for a ductogram which was inconclusive due to no dye being able to be seen on the films.  The doctor told me to notify him of any changes.  I called the other day because my breast is swollen and has a reddish/purple patch that is growing and was promptly given an appointment and also sent to er in case it was an abscess.  Bloodwork at er was fine, no sign of infection.  I was sent home on antibiotics and pain meds.  Follow-up with specialist today ended in recommending me to use heat and stay on meds.  Go in for a recheck in one week. Log in to post a reply
